intro: Onychium tenellum, commonly known as the slender onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its overall rugged appearance. Onychium tenellum is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
